required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Single Arm, Prospective, Open-Label, Staged Study of the Safety and Efficacy of the AuriNovo Construct for Auricular Reconstruction in Subjects With Unilateral Microtia

brief_summary.textblock: AuriNovo provides a patient-specific, biological construct for use in the surgical reconstruction of the external ear in people born with microtia Grades II-IV. This Phase 1 / 2A study is being conducted to collect preliminary safety data on microtic ear reconstruction using AuriNovo, fine-tune technical, logistical, surgical, and post-surgical care aspects related to implantation, and to gather preliminary efficacy data including short- and longer-term in vivo duration and biological status of the implant.

primary_outcome.description: Safety data will be collected on AE type, frequency and severity, treatment, and the time to resolution.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured through overall satisfaction scores
primary_outcome.description: Data will be collected to determine the suitability of the AACC to support reconstruction of the outer ear in microtia patients. The following will be used to determine satisfaction; - Surgical Outcomes Questionnaire (scores range from 15 (lowest satisfaction) to 75 (highest satisfaction))

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured through overall satisfaction scores
primary_outcome.description: Data will be collected to determine the suitability of the AACC to support reconstruction of the outer ear in microtia patients. The following will be used to determine satisfaction; - FACE-Q Kids Questionnaire (scores range from 74 (lowest satisfaction) to 296 (highest satisfaction))

arm_group.description: AuriNovo is a patient-specific, biologically natural, supportive base for surgical reconstruction of the external ear (auricle) in people born with microtia Grades II-IV. The construct is a 3D-bioprinted collagen hydrogel scaffold encapsulating the patient's own auricular cartilage cells (chondrocytes). The construct is printed in a size and shape that matches the contralateral ear for implantation into the patient.

intervention.description: AuriNovo is a patient-specific, biologically natural, supportive base for surgical reconstruction of the external ear (auricle) in people born with microtia Grades II-IV. The construct is a 3D-bioprinted collagen hydrogel scaffold encapsulating the patient's own auricular cartilage cells (chondrocytes). The construct is printed in a size and shape that matches the contralateral ear for implantation into the patient.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Pediatric children 3-11, adolescents 12-16, or adults 17-25 years old
2. Born with unilateral microtia Grade II, III, or IV
3. No previous surgical procedure for auricular reconstruction
4. Normal or near normal hairline position
5. Able to adhere to the follow-up schedule and post-surgery care instructions
6. Deemed an appropriate subject by the treating surgeon
7. Ability for the subject and/or guardian to understand and give informed consent
8. Positive assessment of a functioning superficial temporal arterial and venous system likely to support the temporoparietal fascia (TPF) flap
9. Healthy subjects with no history of cancer, problematic wound healing, or immune disorders
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Hypersensitivity to gentamycin or materials of porcine origin
2. Any co-morbidities likely to affect healing or ability to adhere to the protocol
3. Lifestyle activities likely to affect healing or ability to adhere to the protocol (e.g.,active contact sports and protective gear interferes with wearing post-operative ear cup)
The following syndromes or conditions are additional exclusion factors:
4. Treacher-Collins Syndrome
5. Nager Syndrome
6. Goldenhar syndrome or hemifacial microsomia plus an occlusal cant of 20 degrees or greater
7. Absence of vertical ramus (as diagnosed on physical exam or CT)
8. Absence of zygoma (as diagnosed on physical exam or CT)
9. Significant orbital asymmetry or micro-ophthalmia (as diagnosed on physical exam or CT)
